title: Amherst College Diversity Open Houses (DIVOH)
description: Weekend program for underrepresented students to explore Amherst's campus, student body, faculty, classes, and residence halls. Application Deadline: August 13 at 1pm EST. Program Dates: September 22-24 or October 13-15.

title: Middlebury College Discover Middlebury
description: Program for seniors from traditionally under-represented groups interested in small liberal arts colleges. Application Deadline: August 13. Program Dates: October 7-8.

title: Emory University Preview Program
description: Three-day visit for invited students to explore campus, interact with current students, meet faculty and staff, and stay overnight. Application Deadline: August 15. Program Dates: October 11-13.

title: Scripps College Discover Scripps
description: Two-day program for students from historically underrepresented backgrounds to explore Scripps College campus. Application Deadline: August 15. Program Dates: October 7-8 or October 14-15.

title: Tulane University PreviewTU
description: Students learn about Tulane and New Orleans diversity, explore academic offerings, and immerse in campus life. Priority Deadline: August 15. Program Dates: October 20-22.

title: Bowdoin College Explore Bowdoin
description: Three-day program for high-achieving high school seniors from diverse backgrounds. Application Deadline: August 17 (session 1) or September 21 (session 2). Program Dates: September 20-23 or November 1-4.

title: Claremont McKenna College Preview Fly-in Program
description: Program funding travel for multicultural and first-generation students. Application Deadline: August 18. Program Dates: October 13-16.

title: Carleton College Taste of Carleton (TOC)
description: All-expenses-paid program bringing 60 high school seniors to campus for three days and two nights. Application Deadline: August 19. Program Dates: October 18-20.

title: University of Pennsylvania PEEP
description: Program for academically high-achieving high school seniors from low-income or first-generation backgrounds. Priority Deadline: August 20. Program Dates: October 7-9.

title: Harvey Mudd College FAST Program
description: Future Achievers in Science and Technology program for high-achieving, college-bound seniors. Application Deadline: August 23. Program Dates: September 20-22 or November 8-10.

title: Davidson College Access Davidson
description: Program for high school seniors from traditionally under-represented groups or those without access to visit campus otherwise. Priority Deadline: August 27. Program Dates: October 14-16.

title: Bates College Prologue to Bates
description: Fly-in program for students entering senior year who express interest in inclusive and pluralistic community. Application Deadline: September 1. Program Dates: October 7-9 or October 28-30.

title: Johns Hopkins University HOME Program
description: On-campus overnight program connecting high school seniors to clubs, organizations, and resources of multicultural community. Application Deadline: September 1. Program Dates: September 27-29.

title: Grinnell College Discover Grinnell
description: Great way to get broad overview of Grinnell experience for college search or finalizing application list. Application Deadline: September 3. Program Dates: September 23-24.

title: Haverford College Have-A-Look
description: Program for students from backgrounds traditionally underrepresented in higher education. Priority Deadline: September 7. Program Dates: September 23-25 or October 28-30.

title: Reed College Fall Visit Program
description: Three-day, two-night exploration of Reed and Portland for highly qualified high school seniors. Application Deadline: September 7. Program Dates: October 7-9.

title: Vassar College Vassar View
description: Immersive introduction to Vassar College campus for high-achieving seniors from diverse backgrounds. Application Deadline: September 7. Program Dates: October 7-9.

title: Wesleyan University Transportation Assistance Program (TAP)
description: All-expenses-paid visit for select high school seniors. Two programs: Columbus Day (Oct 7-8) and Veterans Day (Nov 11-12). Application Deadlines: September 7 and October 12.

title: Colgate University Colgate in Focus
description: Program for talented high school seniors who have overcome significant challenges in pursuing post-secondary education. Application Deadline: September 8. Program Dates: October 14-16.

title: Oberlin College Multicultural Visit Program (MVP)
description: Selective, all-expenses-paid visit program for high-achieving seniors interested in College of Arts and Sciences. Application Deadline: September 13 (October) or October 11 (November). Program Dates: October 11-13 or November 8-10.

title: Bucknell University Journey to Bucknell
description: Overnight program for high-achieving, traditionally underrepresented high school seniors. Must have minimum 3.5 unweighted GPA. Priority Deadline: September 14. Program Dates: November 4-6.

title: Dickinson College Discover Diversity at Dickinson
description: Three-day overnight program for promising high-school seniors from traditionally underrepresented backgrounds. Application Deadline: September 14. Program Dates: November 8-10.

title: Babson College Fall Preview Program
description: Program providing students opportunity to experience life on campus including engaging with students, faculty, staff and learning about resources. Application Deadline: Mid-September. Program Dates: October 21-22.

title: Lewis and Clark College Compass Scholars Weekend
description: Opportunity to travel to campus, meet students and faculty, participate in leadership development, experience life at Lewis & Clark. Application Deadline: September 17. Program Dates: November 4-6.

title: Miami University Bridges Program
description: Overnight visit program for diverse and multicultural students. Application Deadline: September 24. Program Dates: November 4-6.

title: Ladder Internships
description: Selective virtual internship program placing high school students at startups and nonprofits worldwide. 10-20 hours/week on real projects with mentorship. Tuition-based (~$2,490) with financial aid available.

title: Stanford SHTEM Summer Internships
description: 8-week remote research internship fostering interdisciplinary collaboration across STEM, humanities, and arts. Students work 30-40 hours/week on group projects. Note: 2025 program on hiatus, resuming 2026.

title: NASA SEES High School Summer Intern Program
description: Nationally competitive STEM internship analyzing NASA satellite data with scientists and engineers. Combines virtual learning (June) and 2-week residential experience in Austin (July). Applications due February 22.

title: Idaho National Laboratory High School Internship
description: DOE-sponsored summer internship (6+ weeks) tackling real-world energy, cybersecurity, and engineering challenges. 80% lab time with mentor, 20% enrichment. Students age 16+ with minimum 3.0 GPA.

title: Science & Engineering Apprenticeship Program (SEAP)
description: Prestigious 8-week paid summer research apprenticeship at U.S. Navy laboratories nationwide. ~300 placements across 38 labs. Students receive $4,000-$4,500 stipend. Applications open August, close November 1.
location: Multiple Navy research labs across U.S.

title: Fermilab TARGET Program
description: Six-week summer internship exposing Illinois high school sophomores and juniors to physics, engineering, and computer science research. Must attend Illinois high school with 3.0+ GPA. Paid hourly (~$17.20/hour).

title: Sandia National Laboratories High School Internship
description: Year-round internship program offering roles in technical R&D, cybersecurity, engineering, and business. Students age 16+ with 3.0+ GPA. Flexible full-time summer or part-time year-round positions.

title: Oak Ridge National Laboratory Internship
description: Summer internship program in advanced scientific research. Students work on cutting-edge projects in nuclear science, materials, computing, and environmental research.

title: Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory Internship
description: Competitive summer internship program for students interested in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics careers. Work with world-class scientists and engineers.

title: Argonne National Laboratory Internship
description: Research participation program providing hands-on experience in scientific research and engineering. Students work alongside leading researchers on innovative projects.

title: American University Summer Programs
description: Learn professional skills from expert faculty using Washington, DC as classroom and laboratory for experiential learning in communication, international studies, and politics. Grades 9-12.

title: Babson College Summer Study
description: Residential program for rising high school juniors and seniors providing real-world experience while building business knowledge and entrepreneurial skills. Grades 10-12.

title: Boston University Summer Programs
description: Portfolio of challenging summer high school programs offering opportunity to explore new subjects and college life with students from 50 states and 87 countries. Grades 9-12.

title: Brandeis University Precollege Programs
description: Outstanding residential experiences for exceptional high school students exploring academic and artistic pursuits with diverse global community. Grades 10-12.

title: Brown University Pre-College Programs
description: Experience college, prepare for academic success, and make friends from around the world. Multiple sessions 1-7 weeks, 300+ courses on campus, online, and abroad. Grades 9-12.

title: UCLA Summer Programs
description: UCLA opens doors to high school students in welcoming environment appreciating diversity and global perspectives. Grades 9-12.

title: UCLA Game Lab Summer Institute
description: Introduces high school students to game-making as artistic practice, teaching techniques and tools for analog and digital games. No previous game-making skills required. Grades 9-12.

title: UC San Diego Summer Programs
description: Summer academic programs for high school students to explore university-level coursework and campus life. Grades 9-12.

title: Carleton College Liberal Arts Experience (CLAE)
description: One-week summer program for 52 high school students who completed sophomore year, all expenses paid. Introduces strengths of liberal arts education through science, art, social sciences, and technology. Grade 10.

title: Carnegie Mellon University Pre-College
description: Summer Pre-College programs showing life at Carnegie Mellon from classroom to weekends. Meet people worldwide, learn from world-renowned faculty, explore Pittsburgh. Grades 10-11.

title: University of Chicago Summer Programs
description: Immerse in college experience raising interests and abilities to new levels. Learn from scholars, researchers, and educators transforming how we see our world. Grades 9-12.

title: Columbia University Summer High School Program
description: Intensive academic experience on Columbia's campus with college-level courses taught by Columbia faculty and graduate students.

title: Cornell University Summer Programs
description: Pre-college programs offering high school students opportunity to experience Cornell's academic environment and campus life.

title: Harvard University Summer Programs
description: Rigorous academic programs allowing high school students to experience Harvard's intellectual environment and campus community.

title: Johns Hopkins Center for Talented Youth
description: Intensive academic programs for academically talented students to explore advanced topics and accelerate learning.

title: MIT Summer Programs
description: Various programs exposing high school students to MIT's cutting-edge research and academic environment in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics.

title: Stanford University Summer College
description: Intensive academic experience allowing high school students to take college-level courses and experience Stanford campus life.

title: Research Science Institute (RSI)
description: Six-week, cost-free program at MIT for students to conduct original research projects with mentors. Widely regarded as most prestigious science program for high schoolers.

title: NASA High School Aerospace Scholars
description: Interactive online learning experience highlighted by six-day internship where students study math, science, engineering, or computer science by interacting with NASA engineers.
location: NASA Johnson Space Center, Houston, TX

title: Telluride Association Summer Program (TASP)
description: Six-week educational experience offering challenges and rewards rarely encountered in secondary school or college. All expenses paid. Very prestigious program.
location: Cornell University and University of Michigan

title: Boston University Summer Challenge Program
description: General academic summer program for high school students to experience college-level coursework and campus life with comprehensive support services.

title: Carleton College Liberal Arts Experience
description: High school students who are current sophomores invited to one-week summer program at Carleton College, all expenses paid. Introduces liberal arts education strengths.

title: Carnegie Mellon Pre-College
description: Summer Pre-College programs showing what life at Carnegie Mellon is about from classroom to weekends. Meet people from all over world, be inspired by world-renowned faculty.

title: Research Science Institute (RSI)
description: Six-week, cost-free program designed to kick-start careers of leadership in science, mathematics, engineering, and technology held at MIT. Most prestigious competitive science program for high school students.

title: Telluride Association Summer Program (TASP)
description: Six-week educational experience for high school juniors offering challenges and rewards rarely encountered in secondary school or college. All expenses paid, very prestigious.
location: Cornell University and University of Michigan

title: Academic Study Associates/Summerfuel
description: Independent academic summer program providing enriching educational experiences for motivated high school students.

title: Summer Institute for the Gifted
description: Academic enrichment program designed for intellectually gifted and academically talented students to explore advanced topics.

title: Education Unlimited
description: Summer programs offering academic enrichment and college preparation experiences for high school students.

title: Summer Discovery
description: Pre-college summer programs on prestigious university campuses offering academic courses and college preparation.

title: MD Anderson High School Summer Program
description: Eight-week summer program for graduating high school seniors at University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center. Introduces qualified young Texans to research environment and biomedical sciences careers. 20 students selected.

title: Summer Science Program (SSP)
description: Residential enrichment program where gifted high school students complete challenging, hands-on research project in celestial mechanics. Learn college-level astronomy, physics, calculus, and programming by day, take telescopic observations by night.

title: Baylor High School Summer Science Research Program
description: Gives superior high school students hands-on research experience working on projects with Baylor University science professors across many disciplines. Occurs during university's first summer session.

title: Research Science Institute (RSI)
description: Six-week, cost-free program designed to kick-start careers of leadership in science, mathematics, engineering, and technology held at MIT. Widely regarded as 'most prestigious competitive science program for high school students in the nation'.

title: Telluride Association Summer Program (TASP)
description: Six-week educational experience for high school juniors offering challenges and rewards rarely encountered in secondary school or college. All expenses paid. Very prestigious program with many students moving to Ivy League schools.
location: Cornell University and University of Michigan

title: Mickey Leland Kibbutzim Internship
description: Non-profit leadership program significantly changing lives of Houston high school students. Helps send students to Israel during summer of junior year for life-changing experience. Students must live in Texas' 18th Congressional District.

title: Asian American Journalists Association J Camp
description: Six-day training camp bringing together multicultural group of high school students nationwide to sharpen journalism skills. No fee to apply, all costs covered including airfare, lodging, and meals. Open to all ethnicities.

title: British American Foundation of Texas Junior Achievers Award
description: 2-4 week study abroad program in United Kingdom for low-income families in Houston area. Students must be 16-17 years old.

title: National Hispanic Youth Initiative Program
description: For current Hispanic 10th and 11th graders considering career in health care or biomedical research. Eight-day program held in Washington DC providing intensive exposure to healthcare fields.

title: West Point Summer Leaders Seminar
description: Week-long immersion in academic, military and social life for those considering West Point. Explore West Point from all angles including intense military training and athletic activities.

title: NASA High School Aerospace Scholars
description: Interactive online learning experience highlighted by six-day internship where selected students study math, science, engineering, or computer science by interacting with engineers at NASA Johnson Space Center. Must be 16+ and junior in high school.

title: Bank of America Student Leaders Internship
description: Eight-week paid internship at nonprofit/charitable organization in Houston plus week-long Student Leadership Summit in Washington, DC (all expenses paid). Gain valuable civic, social and business leadership skills.

title: Carleton College Liberal Arts Experience (CLAE)
description: High school students who are current sophomores invited to one-week summer program at Carleton College, all expenses paid. Introduces strengths of liberal arts education through science, art, social sciences, and technology.

title: Duke University Talent Identification Program Field Studies
description: Advanced-level coursework allowing students to study from experts in their fields and gain international experience. Programs include clinical psychology, archaeology, music, creative writing, and filmmaking.

title: Junior Statesman Foundation Summer Programs
description: Opportunity for outstanding freshmen, sophomores, and juniors with interest in politics and current events. Learn about politics and government in dynamic academic environment on Georgetown, Princeton, and Stanford campuses.

title: Close Up Summer High School Program
description: Six-day program giving in-depth look at government using Washington, DC as living classroom. Opportunity to earn college credit from University of Virginia. Multiple summer programs available.
